title: How to Repair a Warped Debit or Credit Card

steps.headline: Gather your supplies; paper bag, iron, very flat surface.
steps.description: I like to use a cutting board as my flat surface.

steps.headline: Warm the iron on a low and dry setting.
steps.description: About a level 2 heat setting is appropriate.

steps.headline: Place the debit/credit card just inside the paper bag.
steps.description: Lay both flat on the very flat surface.

steps.headline: Aim for the magnetic swipe strip.
steps.description: That's the only part of the card that absolutely needs flattening. Don't flatten the numbers!

steps.headline: Once you know you've got your aim dead on, press and continuously move the iron back and forth for 30 seconds or less.
Check your results.
steps.description: Is your card flat? If not, repeat steps until the swipe section is flat.

methods.name: Using a hair dryer to flatten the card

steps.headline: Find a hair dryer.
steps.description: Place your card on a flat surface that can handle being heated up.

steps.headline: Heat up the card with the hair dryer.
steps.description: When warmed up, bend the card in the direction it needs to go to flatten again.

steps.headline: Place the card between the flat surface and a heavy object, such as a large book or other flat object.
steps.description: Use the heavy item to hold it down.

steps.headline: Leave for a short time to flatten the card.
steps.description: Remove the card and it should be flat again.
